alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 17 at 3:31PM EDT until October 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow is expected across northern portions of the county. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Less than 1 inch is expected across southern portions of the county from Iron River to Crystal Falls. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Iron County. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree branches, resulting in sporadic power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Since this is the first winter storm of the season, extra caution is urged for those who must travel.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
